intro: Rochelia, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Plumbaginaceae. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and are adapted to salty, well-drained soils. Rochelia species are characterized by their blue or purple flowers and silver-gray foliage. They are often used in ornamental gardening due to their hardy nature and attractive appearance. The genus includes several species, such as Rochelia maritima and Rochelia hispida.
